about.description:
I build apps that feel right â€” fast, clean, and designed with purpose. My path into tech was not the typical one. I started out just trying to make a web page with a guestbook (it was ugly, but it worked). Then life pulled me into wild detours: consulting, managing artists, recruiting, logistics. All of it taught me how people think, what they need, and how broken most software really is. |

Eventually, I got pulled back in â€” this time through C++ and Arduino â€” and I havenâ€™t looked back. Now, I bring all that real-world grit into every product I build. Whether itâ€™s frontend, backend, or wired up to hardware, I love solving real problems with simple, powerful solutions.

experience.101: EPAM Systems | Software Engineer | Vilnius, Lithuania | Collaborated with a team to enhance ERP integration for a European e-commerce platform. Rebuilt the admin panel, optimized React components and API handlers, reducing load times by up to 5x. Ensured thorough test coverage through integration, visual regression, and BDD testing. Coordinated with the product owner and designer for feature reviews. Led candidate interviews and onboarding.

Engage in analysis, design, and implementation of business-critical applications, including UI, server services, and database implementation.

The program covers core services such as Lambda, DynamoDB, and SQS, while providing in-depth training in CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and event-driven architectureâ€”laying a strong foundation for becoming a proficient, cloud-native engineer.
